title: Sterling hit by Letwin amendment as businesses urge MPs to support deal
text:
Businesses have urged MPs to back Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal and end the deadlock as early trading data indicated the latest delay will derail sterling’s strongest surge in a decade.

The City faced more uncertainty after a vote on the prime minister’s deal was pushed back as businesses pleaded with the prime minister to stop the UK leaving the EU without a deal.

Adam Marshall, director general at the British Chambers of Commerce, said businesses need an “iron-clad guarantee” a no-deal Brexit would be averted after Mr Johnson warned he will not negotiate a delay to Brexit with the EU.

Mike Cherry at the Federation of Small Businesses, said frustrated businesses want an end to the paralysis...
